data.title: Ray Brassier. Essay Collection..
data.meta_description: Ray Brassier. Essay Collection Language: English  Number of works: 17    ———————————————————————————————————————————————  About the aut
data.text:
Language: English

Number of works: 17

———————————————————————————————————————————————

About the author:

Raymond Brassier is a member of the philosophy faculty at the American University of Beirut, Lebanon, known for his work in philosophical realism. He was formerly Research Fellow at the Centre for Research in Modern European Philosophy at Middlesex University, London, England.

Brassier is the author of Nihil Unbound: Enlightenment and Extinction and the translator of Alain Badiou's Saint Paul: The Foundation of Universalism and Theoretical Writings and Quentin Meillassoux's After Finitude: An Essay on the Necessity of Contingency. He first attained prominence as a leading authority on the works of François Laruelle.

Brassier is of mixed French-Scottish ancestry, and his family name is pronounced in the French manner.

———————————————————————————————————————————————
